locutie.beschrijving: Historical context of Philadelphia, the meaning of its name, the metaphor of the open door, and the character of Christ as the one with the keys.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. Strong on historical/geographical context; weaker on the apocalyptic genre, focusing instead on personal application.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts historical facts and personal testimonies, then shifts to encouraging/commanding the hearer to 'try' and 'trust'.
voorbeelden: I am thinking of a city in Asia Minor.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Encouragement, motivation to persevere, and political/social mobilization.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is mentioned as a historical 'spirit of Christ' rather than the active agent of the sermon event.

voorbeelden: Philadelphia's importance was due to the fact...
The word literally means 'love of a brother'.
Miracles are going on in people's lives.
I am always greatly touched when I read that passage.
I hope it was better than some others.
The Lord can and will open doors for you.
He will make people who said you cannot watch you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. They function more as general predictions of God's character than specific sacramental promises addressed to the hearer's situation.

voorbeelden: I stand before you to testify...
I tell you something else that God will do.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The authority is derived from personal experience ('no neophyte speaking') rather than the office of the keys or the Word.

indicatoren: Extensive travelogue about Philadelphia's walls and postal routes.
Long anecdotal story about John Hutton and the miner.
Theological lecturing on the meaning of 'holy'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of the preacher's memories and historical knowledge rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Present-tense address of God's action now.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is left with 'advice' to try harder rather than 'grace' that enables.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Vague and conditional on the hearer's effort.
voorbeelden: If you've got the faith, you can walk in.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Autobiographical (I remember, I think, I stand).

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address often used for moral exhortation (You must know, Don't you believe it).

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing God, the ancient church, and 'people'.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General principles about how God works.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God opens doors) -> Directive (So you must try/trust).
voorbeelden: Our effort must come first... Seek and ye shall find.
foutief_patroon.probleem: Reverses the Gospel priority; makes God's action contingent on human effort (synergism).

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a motivational speech. It uses biblical data to urge the hearer toward self-actualization and effort, rather than bestowing grace.

zwakke_punten.probleem: Undermines the performative nature of grace.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is more of a 'talk' than an 'event'. The preacher talks about doors rather than opening them through the Word.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the declarative 'I' of the mandatory speaking in God's name.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of historical sentences, not the active speaker of the sermon.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Preacher acts as a witness/testifier rather than a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: I stand before you to testify.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is attributed to the hearer's 'effort' and 'faith' rather than the Spirit.
tekstueel_bewijs: If you've got the faith, you can walk in.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is treated as a means of motivation, not a means of grace.
tekstueel_bewijs: I think I will share this word.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many past-tense and third-person verbs. Needs a shift to second-person present-tense performatives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Lord is able to unlock any door.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: By the authority of Christ, I declare that the door of hope is open for you today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth (Assertive) to a present reality (Declarative).

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are conditional on human effort.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Ground the promise in Christ's finished work, not the hearer's 'trying'.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because Christ has the key, your past no longer locks your future.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'You' (Hearer) and 'We' (Community) in the context of God's 'Now'.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'if/then' structure creates a new law.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically engaging and historically interesting, but it risks leaving the hearer under the burden of their own 'effort'. Shift from talking about the door to being the voice through which Christ opens it.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (his father's death); SAT reveals this as a distraction from the 'Divine Illocution'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'beer to furniture' story; SAT asks if that story actually performs grace for the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that the preacher's call to 'effort' is a Directive lacking a Commissive foundation.

commissief: The Lord can and will open doors
He will make people watch you
declaratief: I stand before you to testify
I have set before thee an open door (quoting Christ)

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I have set before thee an open door.
kernzinnen_analyse.illocutionaire_kracht: Strong, but mediated through a quote rather than direct address.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Testimonial Constative Surplus' where the preacher's own life story and historical knowledge overshadow the performative 'Now' of the Gospel.
